humor.text: The most dangerous game is trying to function normally with wet nails.
My favorite exercise is running out of patience while my top coat dries.
I'm one manicure away from having my life completely together.
Choosing a nail polish color is the hardest decision I'll make all week.
My nail polish collection is starting to look like a small paint store.
I'm not saying I'm indecisive, but I've been staring at this polish wall for an hour.
Life is too short to have boring nails.
My brain has two modes: 'I need to save money' and 'Ooh, a new glitter polish!'
The three scariest words: 'Your card, please,' right after a manicure.
I do my own nails, which is basically an extreme sport.
Just spent an hour on my nails, so now I am unable to do anything else.
May your coffee be strong and your top coat be stronger.
Relationship status: In a long-term commitment with this nail color.
So many nail polishes, so few fingers.
I call this look 'I tried to do nail art and now there's glitter on the cat'.
The best part of a manicure is pretending you're a hand model for the next hour.
My superpower is being able to smudge a manicure that's been dry for hours.
I'm sorry for what I said when I was waiting for my nails to dry.
You know you're an adult when you get excited about a new top coat.
My non-dominant hand's nail art always looks like a modern art masterpiece.
Forget the glass slipper, this princess wants a new set of nails.
I have it all together, I just forgot where I put it... probably near my polish collection.
I trust my manicurist more than I trust most of my own decisions.
Nails without a little sparkle is like a cake without frosting.
Patience is touching your nails together to see if they're dry yet.
I want my nails to be this color, but also this color, and maybe this one too.
What do you mean I have too much nail polish? That's not a thing.
The only thing I'm committed to right now is this shade of red.
My nails are not a snack, I repeat, my nails are not a snack.
I have a degree in 'which of these 5 identical pinks should I wear?'.
My favorite season is when the new nail polish collections drop.
Keep calm and paint your nails.
A manicure is just a therapy session with a prettier result.
I wish my bank account refilled as fast as I find new polishes to buy.
The moment of sheer terror when you have an itch and your nails are wet.
You can't buy happiness, but you can buy nail polish, which is kind of the same thing.
I'm not perfect, but my nails are, and that's what really matters.
I use my freshly manicured nails to point at things I can't pick up.
The first chip in a new manicure feels like a tiny tragedy.
My nail tech knows more about my life than my own journal.
There's no problem so big that a new manicure can't make it a little better.
I'm pretty sure my blood type is glitter.
My hobbies include buying nail polish and then using the same three colors over and over.
Waving goodbye to my money as I enter the nail salon.
The 'is it dry?' nail tap is the riskiest game you can play.
I consider 'removing glitter polish' an Olympic sport.
That awkward moment when your nails are longer than your patience.
My nail art is my favorite way to be loud without saying a word.
Behind every successful person is a substantial amount of nail polish.
Don't judge a person by their messy hair, judge them by their flawless manicure.
I'm not addicted to nail polish, we're just in a very committed relationship.
Feeling stressed? There's a nail polish for that.
The only drama I enjoy is in my nail art.
My nail polish costs more than my lunch, and I see nothing wrong with that.
The floor of my room is now permanently glitter-coated, and I've accepted it.
I speak fluent nail polish: 'I'm Not Really a Waitress' and 'Lincoln Park After Dark'.
You think I'm listening, but I'm really just admiring my nails.
Opening a can of soda is the ultimate test of a fresh manicure's strength.
My weekly schedule revolves around my manicure appointment.
I'm not lazy, I'm just in 'don't-mess-up-my-nails' mode.
My favorite part of the day is when my nails are finally, truly, 100% dry.
I have 99 problems but my nails ain't one.
I like my nails how I like my jokes: a little bit twisted.
Some people meditate, I just paint my nails.
My nail polish collection is my most valuable and least practical asset.
If you see me with a chipped nail, please know that I'm not okay.
Trying to type with long nails is a skill that should go on my resume.
I'm emotionally attached to a tiny bottle of colored lacquer.
My nails are my canvas, and I'm a very indecisive artist.
A day without nail polish is like... just kidding, I have no idea.
My 'rainy day fund' is just for emergency manicures.
The greatest love story ever told is me and my top coat.
I'm powered by coffee and cuticle oil.
If I had a dollar for every bottle of polish I own, I could afford another bottle.
Life is a journey, and I'm just trying to not chip my nails along the way.
The quiet confidence that comes from having perfectly polished nails is underrated.
My nails are in their 'growing out the mistake' phase.
I've started measuring time in manicures.
Pro tip: If you can't decide on a color, just use all of them.
I'm not clumsy, my nails are just so fabulous they need their own personal space.
I don't need a mood ring, I have nail polish.
My nail tech is the only person I let get that close with a sharp object.
I might have trust issues, but at least my nail polish has a good base.
Organization is putting all your nail polishes in color order.
Some people wear their heart on their sleeve, I wear my art on my nails.
My natural nail color is 'whatever I couldn't get off from the last manicure'.
My hands look so much more elegant when I'm not using them to open a jar.
I'd stop buying nail polish, but I'm no quitter.
The only thing getting lit this weekend are my UV gel lamps.
My favorite fantasy is a nail polish that dries instantly and never chips.
I believe in manicures on Mondays to start the week off right.
My nail art is a cry for help... a very fabulous cry for help.
I have a black belt in applying nail polish in a moving car.
Today's good mood is sponsored by my new manicure.
My will to function is directly proportional to how good my nails look.
I'm just a girl, standing in front of a polish rack, asking it to love her.
I've learned more about patience from doing my nails than from anything else in life.
The difference between a good day and a bad day is a fresh coat of polish.
My nails are my tiny, colorful bodyguards against a dull day.
I whisper 'don't you dare chip' to my nails at least ten times a day.
